item.title: Recalibrating the Devonian time scale
item.description: Three new timescales for the Devonian. The biotic, climatic, and tectonic events of the Devonian cannot be correlated and investigated without a well-calibrated time scale.

item.title: Changing Diets Helped Grey Wolves Survive Pleistocene Extinctions
item.description: Grey wolves pursuing a horse on the Yukon mammoth steppe during the late Pleistocene.
About I’m a geochemist and paleoecologist. My research focuses on the interaction between climate and ecology and has spanned geologic time from the Cambrian to present day.

Collaborators As a professional researcher at the University of California Merced, I welcome the opportunity to work folks across the university, especially with student researchers at the graduate and undergraduate level.

item.title: Geochronology & Modeling
item.description: My research focuses on understanding the rate and tempo of earth processes with an emphasis on modeling the long-term accumulation of sediment from stratigraphic sections and rock cores, using Bayesian modeling.
